H0.text: Friction is the heat that warms the student’s hands when she rubs them together on a cold winter day.

H1.text: Gravity is the force that produces the heat that warms the student’s hands when she rubs them together on a cold winter day.

H2.text: Light is the heat that warms her hands when a student rubs her hands together on a cold winter day.

H3.text: Magnetism is the source of the heat that warms the student's hands when she rubs them together on a cold winter day.

A4.text: the algebraic sum of the quantities of heat gained by the two systems is equal to the quantity of work lost by friction
